info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 7:24PM CDT until April 08 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS IN MISSISSIPPI AND LOUISIANA... .The combination of low relative humidity near or below 20 percent and winds of 15 to 20 mph with higher gusts will produce a high fire danger across portions of Mississippi and Louisiana Friday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR SOUTHWEST AND COASTAL MISSISSIPPI AND SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA... The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM to 7 PM CDT Friday. * AFFECTED AREA...In all of Southeast Louisiana and Coastal and Southwest Mississippi...including Fire Weather Zones 034, 035, 036, 037, 039, 046, 047, 048, 056, 057, 058, 059, 060, 064, 065, 066, 067, 068, 068, 069, 069, 070, 070, 071, 071, 076, 077, 077, 078, 079, 080, 080, 081, 081, 082, 082, 083, 084, 085, 086, 087, 088, 089, and 090... * WIND...Northwesterly winds of 15 to 20 mph with gusts near 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity values at or lower than 20 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
